intro: Lachenalia glaucina var. parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its unique appearance and resilience.
